intro: Hedyotis coreana var. luxurians, commonly known as the Korean bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to Korea. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale yellow flowers, which are typically arranged in terminal inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
